official-title.#text:
To prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the
			 United States, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text:
Unless explicitly authorized by law, no agency or instrumentality of the Federal Government may
			 issue after July 30, 2014, guidance, memorandums, regulations, policies,
			 or other similar instruments the effect of which is—

to newly authorize deferred action for any class of aliens not in lawful immigration status in the
			 United States; or
to newly authorize any alien to work in the United States if such alien—

was not lawfully admitted into the United States in compliance with the immigration laws (as
			 defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
), except that this subparagraph shall not apply to an
			 alien who is paroled under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 101(a)(17) of the Immigration and Nationality Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or permitted to land temporarily as
			 an alien crewman; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 212(d)(5) of the Immigration and
			 Nationality Act

text.#text: is not lawfully present in the United States.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5272 IH: To prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
